name: MantleBio
headline: Transform scientific data into discoveries
description: Mantle brings modern data engineering to the lab to help scientists turn insights into world-changing breakthroughs.

founders.name: Emily Damato, Founder
founders.description: CEO and Co-Founder of MantleBio, modern data engineering for biotech. Previously developed software at GRAIL, Arsenal Bio, and The Broad Institute. MIT Computer Science and Biology. 10+ years at the intersection of computer science and life science.

founders.name: Madeline Schade, Founder
founders.description: CTO and Co-Founder of MantleBio. Previously worked as a software engineer at Google, Arsenal Bio and GRAIL.

### Jumpstart your research with ready-to-run workflows.
### [View all workflows **- >**](https://www.mantlebio.com/<./workflows>)
### [View all workflows **- >**](https://www.mantlebio.com/<./workflows>)
[![Heatmap of showcasing a downsampled subset of data from "Repression of divergent noncoding transcription by a sequence-specifi transcription factor" \(Wu, A. C. K., Patel, H., Chia, M., Moretto, F., Frith, D., Snijders, A. P., & van Werven, F. J. \(2018\)\). This is an example or cover image showcasing capabilities of the Bulk RNA sequencing \(RNAseq\) template or workflow, which are often typically in FASTQ format and the ability of Mantle to run powerful pipelines, like the nf-core rnqseq pipeline, to process bioinformatics data.](https://framerusercontent.com/images/hKhmM5mljurKnSnyhbhO5D5o2Q.png?scale-down-to=1024)![Heatmap of showcasing a downsampled subset of data from "Repression of divergent noncoding transcription by a sequence-specifi transcription factor" \(Wu, A. C. K., Patel, H., Chia, M., Moretto, F., Frith, D., Snijders, A. P., & van Werven, F. J. \(2018\)\). This is an example or cover image showcasing capabilities of the Bulk RNA sequencing \(RNAseq\) template or workflow, which are often typically in FASTQ format and the ability of Mantle to run powerful pipelines, like the nf-core rnqseq pipeline, to process bioinformatics data.](https://framerusercontent.com/images/hKhmM5mljurKnSnyhbhO5D5o2Q.png?scale-down-to=1024)![Heatmap of showcasing a downsampled subset of data from "Repression of divergent noncoding transcription by a sequence-specifi transcription factor" \(Wu, A. C. K., Patel, H., Chia, M., Moretto, F., Frith, D., Snijders, A. P., & van Werven, F. J. \(2018\)\). This is an example or cover image showcasing capabilities of the Bulk RNA sequencing \(RNAseq\) template or workflow, which are often typically in FASTQ format and the ability of Mantle to run powerful pipelines, like the nf-core rnqseq pipeline, to process bioinformatics data.](https://framerusercontent.com/images/hKhmM5mljurKnSnyhbhO5D5o2Q.png?scale-down-to=1024)Bulk RNA Sequencing **- >**Identify differentially-expressed genes and more from bulk RNAseq data.](https://www.mantlebio.com/<https:/docs.mantlebio.com/workflows/bulk_rnaseq_analysis_scanpy>)
[![Split-screen image of spatial transcriptomics, the visualizaition and quantification of gene expression in tissue sections while maintain the context of tissue architecture. To perform sequence alignment, a reference genome is needed. One technology for spatial transcriptomics is 10x Genomics Visium which uses a slide array of spots, each containing barcoded oligonucleotides, to capture mRNA from tissue sections placed on the slide. The mRNA then undergoes high-throughput RNA sequencing. The raw results from Visium experiments include a microscopy image of the tissue slice on the Visium slide and sequencing reads in FASTQ format. In order to use this data to reveal insights into cellular microenvironments, cellular heterogeneity, and spatial relationships within tissue, the data require processing, including the typical steps taken for processing RNA sequencing reads, as well as tissue detection and determination of which barcode spots overlap with the tissue.](https://framerusercontent.com/images/xSlrpb9lobREVCvdSLEcIAkh4.png?scale-down-to=1024)![Split-screen image of spatial transcriptomics, the visualizaition and quantification of gene expression in tissue sections while maintain the context of tissue architecture. To perform sequence alignment, a reference genome is needed. One technology for spatial transcriptomics is 10x Genomics Visium which uses a slide array of spots, each containing barcoded oligonucleotides, to capture mRNA from tissue sections placed on the slide. The mRNA then undergoes high-throughput RNA sequencing. The raw results from Visium experiments include a microscopy image of the tissue slice on the Visium slide and sequencing reads in FASTQ format. In order to use this data to reveal insights into cellular microenvironments, cellular heterogeneity, and spatial relationships within tissue, the data require processing, including the typical steps taken for processing RNA sequencing reads, as well as tissue detection and determination of which barcode spots overlap with the tissue.](https://framerusercontent.com/images/xSlrpb9lobREVCvdSLEcIAkh4.png?scale-down-to=1024)Spatial Transcriptomics **- >**Gain insights into spatial gene expression patterns from 10x Genomics Visium Data.](https://www.mantlebio.com/<https:/docs.mantlebio.com/workflows/visium_visualizations>)
[![Split-screen image of spatial transcriptomics, the visualizaition and quantification of gene expression in tissue sections while maintain the context of tissue architecture. To perform sequence alignment, a reference genome is needed. One technology for spatial transcriptomics is 10x Genomics Visium which uses a slide array of spots, each containing barcoded oligonucleotides, to capture mRNA from tissue sections placed on the slide. The mRNA then undergoes high-throughput RNA sequencing. The raw results from Visium experiments include a microscopy image of the tissue slice on the Visium slide and sequencing reads in FASTQ format. In order to use this data to reveal insights into cellular microenvironments, cellular heterogeneity, and spatial relationships within tissue, the data require processing, including the typical steps taken for processing RNA sequencing reads, as well as tissue detection and determination of which barcode spots overlap with the tissue.](https://framerusercontent.com/images/xSlrpb9lobREVCvdSLEcIAkh4.png?scale-down-to=1024)Spatial Transcriptomics **- >**Gain insights into spatial gene expression patterns from 10x Genomics Visium Data.](https://www.mantlebio.com/<https:/docs.mantlebio.com/workflows/visium_visualizations>)
[![Fluorescence microscopy experiments and workflows enable researchers to visualize specific biological macromolecules in tissues or cell cultures, using probes, antibody staining, or fluorescent protein conjugation, to visualize proteins of interest.](https://framerusercontent.com/images/13LK3Mrj06u6mQWZ1EyBvs0sNY.png?scale-down-to=1024)![Fluorescence microscopy experiments and workflows enable researchers to visualize specific biological macromolecules in tissues or cell cultures, using probes, antibody staining, or fluorescent protein conjugation, to visualize proteins of interest.](https://framerusercontent.com/images/13LK3Mrj06u6mQWZ1EyBvs0sNY.png?scale-down-to=1024)Imaging **- >**Quantify protein localization patterns from fluorescence microscopy images.](https://www.mantlebio.com/<https:/docs.mantlebio.com/workflows/fluorescence_quantification>)
[![Fluorescence microscopy experiments and workflows enable researchers to visualize specific biological macromolecules in tissues or cell cultures, using probes, antibody staining, or fluorescent protein conjugation, to visualize proteins of interest.](https://framerusercontent.com/images/13LK3Mrj06u6mQWZ1EyBvs0sNY.png?scale-down-to=1024)Imaging **- >**Quantify protein localization patterns from fluorescence microscopy images.](https://www.mantlebio.com/<https:/docs.mantlebio.com/workflows/fluorescence_quantification>)

# Science is better together
# Science is better together
# Science is better together
# Science is better together
### Advancing biology is critical for helping patients and the planet. At Mantle, we're committed to working together to help scientists go faster and further.
![Workshops illustration](https://framerusercontent.com/images/xaAclKIeuQVYSOycbFHm8C0yQ.svg)
![Workshops illustration](https://framerusercontent.com/images/xaAclKIeuQVYSOycbFHm8C0yQ.svg)
### Workshops
New to Mantle? New to code? Mantle hosts free workshops virtually and in person for a wide range of interests and skill sets.
### [Upcoming Events ](https://www.mantlebio.com/<./workflows>)**- >**
### [Upcoming Events ](https://www.mantlebio.com/<./workflows>)**- >**
![Education illustration](https://framerusercontent.com/images/Hr2eOyLxw5it4JBfu1LmbjeiLY.svg)
![Education illustration](https://framerusercontent.com/images/Hr2eOyLxw5it4JBfu1LmbjeiLY.svg)
### Learn More
Our favorite thing about science is lifelong learning. Come learn with us by visiting our blogs and let us know what you think.
### [Blogs ](https://www.mantlebio.com/<./workflows>)**- >**
### [Blogs ](https://www.mantlebio.com/<./workflows>)**- >**

This is an example or cover image showcasing capabilities of the Bulk RNA sequencing \(RNAseq\) template or workflow, which are often typically in FASTQ format and the ability of Mantle to run powerful pipelines, like the nf-core rnqseq pipeline, to process bioinformatics data.⟨17⟩]Bulk RNA Sequencing **- >**Identify differentially-expressed genes and more from bulk RNAseq data.](https://www.mantlebio.com/<https:/docs.mantlebio.com/workflows/bulk_rnaseq_analysis_scanpy>)
![Split-screen image of spatial transcriptomics, the visualizaition and quantification of gene expression in tissue sections while maintain the context of tissue architecture. To perform sequence alignment, a reference genome is needed. One technology for spatial transcriptomics is 10x Genomics Visium which uses a slide array of spots, each containing barcoded oligonucleotides, to capture mRNA from tissue sections placed on the slide. The mRNA then undergoes high-throughput RNA sequencing. The raw results from Visium experiments include a microscopy image of the tissue slice on the Visium slide and sequencing reads in FASTQ format. In order to use this data to reveal insights into cellular microenvironments, cellular heterogeneity, and spatial relationships within tissue, the data require processing, including the typical steps taken for processing RNA sequencing reads, as well as tissue detection and determination of which barcode spots overlap with the tissue.⟨18⟩![Split-screen image of spatial transcriptomics, the visualizaition and quantification of gene expression in tissue sections while maintain the context of tissue architecture. To perform sequence alignment, a reference genome is needed. One technology for spatial transcriptomics is 10x Genomics Visium which uses a slide array of spots, each containing barcoded oligonucleotides, to capture mRNA from tissue sections placed on the slide. The mRNA then undergoes high-throughput RNA sequencing. The raw results from Visium experiments include a microscopy image of the tissue slice on the Visium slide and sequencing reads in FASTQ format. In order to use this data to reveal insights into cellular microenvironments, cellular heterogeneity, and spatial relationships within tissue, the data require processing, including the typical steps taken for processing RNA sequencing reads, as well as tissue detection and determination of which barcode spots overlap with the tissue.⟨18⟩]Spatial Transcriptomics **- >**Gain insights into spatial gene expression patterns from 10x Genomics Visium Data.](https://www.mantlebio.com/<https:/docs.mantlebio.com/workflows/visium_visualizations>)
![Split-screen image of spatial transcriptomics, the visualizaition and quantification of gene expression in tissue sections while maintain the context of tissue architecture. To perform sequence alignment, a reference genome is needed. One technology for spatial transcriptomics is 10x Genomics Visium which uses a slide array of spots, each containing barcoded oligonucleotides, to capture mRNA from tissue sections placed on the slide. The mRNA then undergoes high-throughput RNA sequencing. The raw results from Visium experiments include a microscopy image of the tissue slice on the Visium slide and sequencing reads in FASTQ format. In order to use this data to reveal insights into cellular microenvironments, cellular heterogeneity, and spatial relationships within tissue, the data require processing, including the typical steps taken for processing RNA sequencing reads, as well as tissue detection and determination of which barcode spots overlap with the tissue.⟨18⟩Spatial Transcriptomics **- >**Gain insights into spatial gene expression patterns from 10x Genomics Visium Data.](https://www.mantlebio.com/<https:/docs.mantlebio.com/workflows/visium_visualizations>)
![Fluorescence microscopy experiments and workflows enable researchers to visualize specific biological macromolecules in tissues or cell cultures, using probes, antibody staining, or fluorescent protein conjugation, to visualize proteins of interest.⟨19⟩![Fluorescence microscopy experiments and workflows enable researchers to visualize specific biological macromolecules in tissues or cell cultures, using probes, antibody staining, or fluorescent protein conjugation, to visualize proteins of interest.⟨19⟩]Imaging **- >**Quantify protein localization patterns from fluorescence microscopy images.](https://www.mantlebio.com/<https:/docs.mantlebio.com/workflows/fluorescence_quantification>)

generated_description:
**Overview of MantleBio**

**1. Company Profile:**
   - **Name:** MantleBio
   - **Founded:** 2023
   - **Employees:** 7
   - **Location:** Not specified
   - **Y Combinator Batch:** S23
   - **Website:** [mantlebio.com](https://www.mantlebio.com)

**2. Mission Statement:**
   - The mission of MantleBio is to transform scientific data into discoveries. They aim to elevate the capabilities of scientists by integrating modern data engineering into their workflow.

**3. Background:**
   - Mantle initially began with a vision to modernize data engineering in laboratories, enabling researchers to extract insights that lead to impactful scientific breakthroughs.

**4. Offerings:**
   - MantleBio provides a suite of solutions for data organization, analysis, and collaboration tailored for the biotech and data science sectors. Their platform allows scientists to transition from informal data exploration to polished, reusable analyses, all hosted in the cloud without the need for complex setups.

**5. Core Features:**
   - **Workflow Automation:** Ready-to-run workflows that facilitate quick research initiation.
   - **Collaborative Notebooks:** Mantle integrates features of electronic lab notebooks with Jupyter Notebooks, enhancing the ability to share and reproduce experiments.
   - **Database Integration:** The Mantle Database allows for seamless organization and accessibility of data and metadata, ensuring that insights are easily retrievable.
   - **Powerful Pipelines:** No-code data analysis pipelines that are designed to scale from small to large datasets.

**6. Team:**
   - The company leverages expertise from diverse sectors, including biotech and big tech, which strengthens their data capabilities.

**7. Tagging:**
   - Categories associated with MantleBio include: SaaS, Biotech, and Data Science.

**8. User Engagement:**
   - MantleBio promotes an interactive community through free workshops and educational resources to familiarize users with their tools and improve their skills in data science and coding in a collaborative atmosphere.

**9. Value Proposition:**
   - MantleBio positions itself as a critical partner in accelerating scientific discoveries, emphasizing the importance of data connectivity and computational productivity in advancing both patient outcomes and environmental challenges.

In summary, MantleBio is setting itself up to be an essential tool in the modern scientist's toolbox, effectively bridging the gap between raw scientific data and meaningful insights that lead to discoveries. If you're looking for a platform to streamline your biological data handling and analysis, it's worth exploring what they offer.
